data.event: Its 2015 population was estimated to be 45,837.

event.title: was surveyed and laid out in 1859

data.event: The original townsite was surveyed and laid out in 1859 by Theodore Judah along the proposed line of the California Central Railroad.
Grading from Folsom to Marysville commenced in 1858 and was completed to Marysville by 1860.
Grading from Folsom to Marysville commenced in 1858 and was completed to Marysville by 1860.

event.title: reached the site of Lincoln in early 1861

data.event: Track laying began that same year and the rails reached the site of Lincoln in early 1861.

event.title: a few years, however, more investors were found

data.event: Within a few years, however, more investors were found and the line was extended to Wheatland, in Yuba County, bringing an end to this early stage of Lincoln's development.
